newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - June 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - June 30.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on June 30. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

The ruling Golkar party has discussed how the nation needs a set of values to face the era of globalisation at a party meeting on the weekend to discuss its input for the broad guidelines of state policy which will be approved by the next parliament.

Privately-owned airline PT Sempati Air, saddled with $245 million in debt, is currently undergoing a major restructuring that will cut the number of its employees and stop some of its domestic and overseas services.
National planning minister Ginandjar Kartasasmita has said that deregulation must be balanced with regulation in order that the weak do not go under.

Coordinating Minister for Security and Political Affairs Soesilo Soedarman has said the government intends to summon East Timor Nobel laureate Bishop Carlos Belo to report on his meetings with U.S. President Bill Clinton and U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Anan.
